alert.note: Alert for Western Mineral (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 14 at 7:06PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...Snow Showers Through This Evening... Occasional snow showers will affect locations along the Allegheny Front, particularly in extreme western Allegany County and extreme western Mineral County. Additional accumulations around one inch are most likely. Temperatures will remain in the upper teens to lower 20s with northwest wind gusts around 45 to 50 mph. The combination of snow showers and strong winds mean that there will be areas of blowing snow that reduce visibility below one-half mile at times. Be prepared for sudden changes in visibility when driving along with snow covered and slippery surfaces.
